message_1:
In a survival analysis study of cancer patients, 100 patients were followed up for a period of 2 years. At the end of the study, 30 patients had died while the remaining 70 were still alive. The survival function for this study is estimated to be S(t) = 0.7^t, where t denotes time in years since the beginning of the study. 

What is the probability that a patient will survive for more than 1 year?
message_2:
To find the probability that a patient will survive for more than 1 year, we can use the survival function S(t) = 0.7^t. In this case, we want to find the probability of survival at t = 1 year. 

S(1) = 0.7^1
S(1) = 0.7

The probability that a patient will survive for more than 1 year is 0.7 or 70%.
